title: The Verb "To Be" (Είμαι). I am, You are.
reading_greek: Είμαι ο Γιάννης. Είμαι καλός. Εσύ είσαι η Μαρία; Είσαι καλή.
reading_english: I am Giannis. I am good. Are you Maria? You are good.
audio_script: Welcome to Week 2 of your Greek journey... Today we focus on the essential verb, To Be, or Είμαι (eemae)... This week we learn the forms for 'I am' and 'You are' (singular)... 'I am' is Είμαι... 'You are' is Είσαι... Listen to the short reading passage now, focusing on these forms: Είμαι ο Γιάννης. Είμαι καλός. Εσύ είσαι η Μαρία; Είσαι καλή... This translates to: I am Giannis. I am good. Are you Maria? You are good... Now, repeat the key phrases after me... I am: Είμαι... You are: Είσαι... Great job!
